column1: Woodhall was a village in the Eastfarthing of the Shire within the woods of Woody End. Frodo Baggins
column2: Samwise Gamgee and Peregrin Took met Gildor and his people on the road near the Woody End above Woodhall
column3: and the three passed close by the village on the last stages of their journey to Bucklebury Ferry.

column1: According to David Salo the name means "hall in a wood"
column2: representing a possible Old English Wuduheall.
towns and villages of the Shire
